intro: Scolymocephalus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian scolymus, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
